title: The van dwellers left with no option but to live on the kerb
description: Ellen looks to the floor as she thinks about how she ended up living in a van.
content:
Ellen looks to the floor as she thinks about how she ended up living in a van.
"I ended up in this situation because my child died a few years ago and I became very unwell. I just needed to be somewhere to try and deal with my bereavement."

title: Nigella Lawson: The new Bake Off judge who breaks the mould
description: What joining Channel 4's famous tent could mean for the TV cook's career and the baking show.
content:
When Nigella Lawson was named as the new judge on the Great British Bake Off, the news was greeted with applause, perhaps a sigh of relief, and a general sense of "oh, of course".

title: A kidnap and a Bitcoin demand
description: Savannah Guthrie's fame has helped turn her mother's abduction into a national obsession.
content:
Before the sun rose over a barren desert landscape, YouTuber Jimmy Williams watched as hundreds of subscribers took to his online chat room.

title: Democrats seek to reassure Europe about post-Trump America
description: Opposition politicians flocked to a summit in Munich to offer an alternative to America First - and stake a claim as future party leaders.
content:
US Secretary of State Marco Rubio was the centre of attention at the Munich Security Summit, as European leaders wondered apprehensively what tone he would strike in his remarks on Saturday.

title: Unions and Labour MPs call on Starmer to end ‘narrow factional agenda’
description: Letter signed by 25 rebel MPs claims approach from the top is ‘increasingly unpopular’ with public
content:
Union leaders and 25 Labour MPs have urged Keir Starmer to end a “narrow, factional agenda” within the Labour party.
A letter signed by the MPs, by the leaders of several Labour-affiliated trade unions and by campaign groupings within the party, clai... [3599 chars]
